result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Paulo Vinci

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution packet, Check issued August 9, 2016.
The Victim/Witness Services Dept. provided corrected name information for the victim on this case.
Restitution packet, Check issued August 2, 2016.
Bail Refund Packets
Restitution Refund Packet
Restitution Refund Packets

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  
Court sets Restitution in the amount of $4,550

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9  MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for  3 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9  MONTHS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 1, with credit for Zero (0)  days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  
NOTE:  the last 6 months of confinement may be served through the Day Reporting Center and with electronic monitoring

COURT ORDERS:
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

As to both counts:  
The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of  2  years with the following conditions:
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Cognitive Behavior Therapy
- AODA evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Random screens
- Comply with any other programs or treatment recommended by the agent
- No Contact with drug users, drug houses, drug dealers, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia, etc.
- No Contact with the victims
- No Contact with individual known as "Country"
- Pay Restitution in the amount of $4,550 as follows during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
- $725 to  John S.
- $400 to  Dennis M.
- $700 to  Frank M.
- $830 to  Kelly H.
- $760 to  Michael S.
- $1,135 to  Hanna Trailers

- Seek/Maintain full-time employment
- Obtain GED/HSD
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Court finds the defendant does not need to provide a DNA sample and is not ordered to pay the surcharge.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant sworn as to his statements.
As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with Attorney George Kidd, appearing for Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State files Amended Information with the court:
Count 1:  Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500) - PTAC, As A Party To A Crime, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05
Count 2:  Theft (Value Not Exceeding $2,500) - PTAC, As A Party To A Crime, a Class A Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(3)(a), 939.05

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney George David Kidd for John Schiro.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea/deferred prosecution agreement.  The Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 26.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing.  Defense counsel requests new date.  The state does not object.    Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  
Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  
Adjourned date selected with the parties before Branch 26.  Filed, Felony Scheduling Order.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Report, received and filed.
Court does not modify bail at this time.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  All conditions of bail remain the same.  Original bail amount remains in effect.

Attorney George David Kidd for John Schiro in court, defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for scheduling conference on August 17, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 26.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney George David Kidd for John Schiro in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court forfeits no bail at this time.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney George David Kidd for attorney John Schiro.  James C. Griffin for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests scheduling conference.  State does not object.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel newly appointed, has received discovery, requests new date.   Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Stipulation and Order for Substitution of Attorneys filed and signed by the Court.
Notice of Retainer from attorney John Schiro filed.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Ronald Dague for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense motion to dismiss the criminal complaint is reviewed and denied by the Court.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ann Golombowski-City of Oak Creek Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/29/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Daniel Paulo Vinci in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
